qualities: Fairness is a core requirement in machine learning models.
A fair system should not disadvantage individuals or groups.
A fair system should not disadvantage individuals based on personal characteristics.
A fair system should not disadvantage groups based on personal characteristics.
Fairness should not disadvantage individuals based on gender.
Fairness should not disadvantage individuals based on ethnicity.
Fairness should not disadvantage individuals based on socioeconomic background.
Bias can arise at multiple stages of the data science workflow.
Historical and social inequalities may be reflected in the data itself.
Data itself may lead to skewed representations of certain populations.
Seemingly neutral choices can unintentionally amplify existing disparities.
Feature selection or normalization can unintentionally amplify existing disparities.
Model selection techniques may introduce bias.
Trainâ€“test splitting or cross-validation may introduce bias.
Bias is introduced if the underlying data distribution is not carefully considered.
Classification models are often evaluated on fairness-related criteria.
Metrics are used to assess whether predictive performance is distributed equitably across different groups.
Improving fairness may affect overall model accuracy.
Explainability plays a crucial role in building trust in automated decision-making systems.
Stakeholders must be able to understand why a model produces a particular outcome.
Transparent explanations can help identify potential sources of bias and support accountability.
Robust explanations are also important to ensure that small changes in the input data do not lead to inconsistent or misleading justifications
Ethical considerations are important in data science applications.
Fairness is an ethical consideration.
Transparency is an ethical consideration.
Respect for human dignity is an ethical consideration.
Data science applications should address fairness.
Data science applications should address transparency.
Data science applications should address respect for human dignity.
Failing to address ethical concerns undermines public trust.
Failing to address ethical concerns causes harm.
Performing well in technical metrics does not guarantee ethical considerations.
